explains: adj. 平凡的，不足为奇的；平庸的，陈腐的
n. 司空见惯的事，常见的东西；老生常谈，陈词滥调

sentences.en: Simpson's much vaunted discoveries are in fact commonplace in modern sociology.
sentences.cn: 辛普森的那些被过分称赞的发现在现代社会学中实际上是老生常谈。

sentences.en: This was only a small part of a war where the slaughter of civilians was commonplace.
sentences.cn: 这只是战争的一小部分，在战争中对平民的屠杀已司空见惯。

sentences.en: Be not content with the commonplace in character.
sentences.cn: 不要满足于普通的共性。
